case_vignette: A 4-year-old boy is brought to the physician in December for episodic shortness of breath and a nonproductive cough for 3 months. These episodes frequently occur before sleeping, and he occasionally wakes up because of difficulty breathing. His mother also reports that he became short of breath while playing with his friends at daycare on several occasions. He is allergic to peanuts. He is at the 55th percentile for height and weight. Vital signs are within normal limits. Examination shows mild scattered wheezing in the thorax. An x-ray of the chest shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?
